data.text: @emvena @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters Just to add this: https://t.co/lBx0pUC28z Here are the Pfizer documents, released per court ruling from the FDA. Side effects are massively underreported.
@Reuters Maybe just say they are not effective, cats out of the bag you criminals
@emvena @EricJM98150810 @WOLKEFN @Reuters Get as many vaccines as you wish, just dont push it on me or my family.

@emvena @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters I mean you can vaccinate yourself and your children as often as you like, but you cannot force it upon other people. As I said: most of your sources are dated to the beginning of 2021, when omicron wasn’t around

@EricJM98150810 @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters You will see what you want to believe. I’m not wasting another minute of my life attempting to educate you. I’ve spent over 30 hours researching the side effects. If you had bothered to compare them in an unbiased way, you would see that Covid carries far greater risk. Period.

@emvena @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters children are getting COVID, because it is nearly impossible for them to evade is. Zero Covid is absolutely unrealistic. And vaccines can be helpful for at risk kids, but not for every child. It HAS to be a individual decision. Tricking kids into vaccination is disturbing

@emvena @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters It my view you now got 
1. Little risk for severe COVID case in children
2. Reduced vaccine efficacy
3. Possible effects of side effects, increasing with every dose (that’s why Israel was strongly discussing against a 4th shot, ADE and OAS)
4. Still a risk for long COVID

@emvena @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters But as your sources clearly indicate, there are substantial side effects, but it was decided that the benefit outweighs the risk. But with the reduce case fatality rate of omicron and the dramatic reduced effect of the vaccine we should think twice about vaccinating kids

@emvena @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters The vaccine is great for people at risk and was important for previous variants. But with omicron we see a extremely high number of breakthrough infections. Even with the booster. So it remains clearly, that the vaccine can only prevent transmission for a short time

2/2

@emvena @ArmasLiberdade @WOLKEFN @Reuters Please don’t expect me to read through all these papers. But I‘ve skimmed most of them and despite the fact that many of the paper are from Jan-Sep 2021 (where Omicron did not play a huge role), let’s just assume, that you are right and Covid effects are more severe.

1/2
